Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 0a4226966443501ca1a57e8e478fe7e554f4824f
Can we mention different systems rather than the names?

+1, community does not care about blueridge/fuji it will be confusing names for them.

The changes here are basically to make sure that we pick a compatible configuration even if we dont have the very first entry from compatible property

Entity manager sends the system names and PLDM checks the presence of the directory type and continues the further operations like .....
Can we write something like this?
@kamal Changes looks good, just some minor nit comments.
not required since already checking for empty string.
make sure similar thing works for BIOS as well , and add a necessary comment about it.
as per our discussion pdr and bios both considered shared common system directory and added assumption in code also.
improved function logic  as per requirement.
Do we expect same system type folders to be present in BIOS configuration and PDRs?
can we use fs::path instead of std::string ?
currently assumption is that pdr and bios both has same system name but in future if any difference found then will create separately
compatible system names (please dont mention entity manager), compatible interface can be hosted by any application.

Cannot understand what this really means, can you please change it to:

```
The current setup assumes that the BIOS and PDR configurations always come from
the same system type. If, in the future, we need to use BIOS and PDR configurations
from different system types, we should create separate system type folders for each
and update the logic to support this.
```
This "available" is redundant here and you could remove it
Change the order of params to dirPath and dirNames according to function signature
Pls change "Getting system names from remote application" --> "System names retrieved from remote application"
